case_title: Commissioner of Income Tax, Assam vs Jalannagar Tea Estate (Private) Ltd., Assam

facts.original_acquisition: Tea estate acquired in 1944 by Barbari Tea Estate Ltd.
facts.name_change: Barbari Tea Estate Ltd. renamed to Jalannagar Tea Estate (Private) Ltd. in 1950
facts.land_sale_agreement: Agreement with Jalannagar Development Co. Ltd. on 1952-07-22 to sell 1,669 bighas at Rs. 3,000 per bigha
facts.taxable_profit: Income Tax Officer assessed Rs. 38,327 as taxable profits
facts.tribunal_findings: Tribunal held profits were capital receipts, not revenue receipts

legal_question: Whether the profit of Rs. 38,327 represented a capital receipt not assessable to tax under the Indian Income Tax Act?

tribunal_decision.finding: No intention to dispose of land for profit at the time of acquisition in 1944
tribunal_decision.nature_of_transaction: Sale proceeds treated as capital receipts, not revenue receipts

references: Raja J. Rameshwar Rao v. Commissioner of Income Tax (1961) 42 ITR 179 (SC)
